hypothesis_content.title: Major Exchange Listing Announcement Fails in Bear Market (Sell the News)
hypothesis_content.statement: In a BEAR or NEUTRAL regime, the official announcement of a major spot listing (e.g., Coinbase, Binance) for a mid-cap altcoin will result in a sharp, fleeting price pump followed by a significant and sustained reversal within 60 minutes, as weak holders and pre-positioned traders sell into the liquidity event.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In non-bull regimes, 'good news' is often a liquidity exit for early buyers and insiders. The announcement is the culmination of a rumor cycle, leaving no new positive catalysts. Retail FOMO buys the spike, providing immediate sell-side liquidity for informed traders. The bear/neutral backdrop lacks the sustained buying pressure to hold elevated prices.
entry_conditions: Official listing announcement timestamp from a Tier-1 exchange (e.g., Coinbase Assets tweet).
Asset experiences a >15% spike within 5 minutes of announcement.
Volume on the initial spike is >5x 24h average but shows declining momentum (lower highs on 1-min RSI).
Price retraces 50% of the initial spike candle.

exit_conditions.take_profit: Short position: Target a full retrace to pre-announcement price levels.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Position invalidated if price breaks to a new high (above spike candle) >1 hour post-announcement.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The listed asset holds >80% of its initial spike gains for over 4 hours and continues to trend upwards, indicating genuine new demand overwhelming sell pressure.
